data.title: The ONLY place for Vietnamese/Thai Food in Springfield
data.text: Mekong Cafe has stopped us from eating at any other oriental type location in Springfield.  There is absolutely no comparison.  It is astronomically the best oriental food in Springfield!  Do not be fooled by the exterior.  The food inside is unbelievable!  They are also a very nice family and will make you feel at home.  I would not hesitate to try Mekong Cafe.  You will not be disappointed!

data.title: Pleasant surprise
data.text: This was my second time and I felt that my comments now will be more fair. The parking on the back is small, so you may need to wait or find another place to park. The place is not big and mainly serves state employees for lunch (very busy). The menu is a mix of dishes from several asian countries (Vietnam, Laos, Thailand). The good: fast (maybe even too fast) and friendly service, reasonable quality of food, easy to find location. The not so good: some of the ingredients are clearly store-bought which make the food quite generic. I was happy overall and will come back.

data.title: Excellent!!
data.text:
I just ate at the Mekong Cafe last night for the first time and the dining experience was excellent!  The parking lot in back is small, but a spot was available.  There IS plenty of parking in the area nearby.  The staff was super nice to us and the service was on point, they knew what we wanted/needed before we did and were all over it.  The food was excellent, everything is very tasty.  On my dish I chose hot level spicy and found it to be perfect.  I like a touch of heat.  The veggies in the dish were cooked yet still had some crunch to them as I chewed, my mouth is watering right now thinking about it !!   

Pro Tip:  do not park in the large parking lot directly next door to the rear of the restaurant,  word is that they are quick to tow any cars from there.  Instead a quick look in the area will find you a decent spot no matter the time of day.  

You won't be disappointed with this restaurant if you love Asian food as I do!!!

data.title: The BEST Thai/Vietmanese restaurant in Springfield!
data.text:
This was a regular stop for me and mine when I still lived in Springfield. Lets put it this way - I don't miss Springfield, but I DO miss this restaurant - so that should say something!

It's easy to pass by because of the somewhat shabby exterior - but don't let that fool you! This place is, without a doubt, the BEST place to get asian food in Springfield. I'm a Thai food fanatic, so I've tried all the other places, and they are good, but Mekong is WAY better.

They get very busy at lunch so I recommend getting there right at 11:00 to avoid the crowd.

I highly recommend the lemongrass soup - the flavor is phenomenal. I also really enjoyed the basil fried rice and just about anything else I've tried on the menu, so you can't go wrong!

data.title: Mediocre
data.text: Loving Vietnamese food as I do I always look for Asian restaurants when I travel.  Decor and ambiance are not very important to me, which is a good thing here.  This is a lunch spot for office workers apparently, and the food is not very authenic.  The fresh rice paper rolls were not well done:  not tightly wrapped, too much noodle, one shrimp, and little green stuff.  The dipping sauce contained fish sauce which was quit a shock.  The noodle salad (bun) was OK.

data.title: Visit about once a week
data.text: Food is excellent! Locally owned restaurant. My boyfriend and I have been going here for over a year every week. Crab Rangoon cannot be beat! Singapore Noodle dish with tofu and Vietnamese Curry Noodle salad are some of my favorites! Just go!

data.title: Great lunch
data.text:
I am trying different  asian restaurants in springfield so I decided to go here.
I had the Beef Bao soup and the Vietnamese spring rolls.the print rolls came with peanut sauce and there is soy sauce and hot sauce on the table.My first time having them.Good not great.but a popular item.The soup was Some of the best I have had.the beef was tender and the noodles were cooked just right.I was here on a week day about noon.The place filled up . about 20 tables.I highly recommend this restaurant.

data.title: Chicken mushroom garlic dish was very good!
data.text: The wonton soup was good, but the wontons have no meat in them, which is fine, as the soup had chicken in it. The shrimp 3 ways dish was ok; too much like sweet and sour though. The chicken mushroom garlic dish was wonderful. The portions were good. The sauces l, vegetables, and meat/seafood was fresh! Will be returning.

data.title: Local Gem
data.text: This restaurant is a local gem. They don't do much advertising, but their food is absolutely amazing. The restaurant is small, so don't miss it...but the service is Great, and the food is excellent.

data.title: Go here now!
data.text:
You won't be sorry. I've been eating at this establishment for several years. Consistently fresh, hot food, perfectly prepared. Staff very pleasant & owner onsite & welcoming. 
I have had numerous dishes, you can't go wrong. 
My favorites- crab rangoon, Vietnamese noodle salad (beef) with the peanut sauce, chicken pad Thai. Fabulous!

data.title: Brown sauce wonder
data.text: It does not matter what dish you order as long as it has the magnificent brown sauce ingredient that makes the dishes exquisite

data.title: I need MEKONG Rehab...I'm addicted
data.text: This is the BEST Thai restaurant in Springfield!  OK- so there aren't any chandeliers or crystal fountains. I'll admit, it's a 'hole in the wall, pull out your own chair, paper napkin, you can hear the woks & cooking utensils in the kitchen kind of place'; but when you get your plate...OMG! Nothing else matters! Even the service is Great! When I go now, they not only know I want Extra Spicy, they even recognize my voice on the phone when I call for take out. LOL! Everyone I take or recommend MEKONG to, gets hooked. Simply put...this place is so good, it's Addictive!

data.title: Don't be fooled! It's spit in your face fantastic!
data.text: At first I was hesitant to go to this restaurant because of how the outside looked. There was a wooden, beaten up sign that said Mekong Café. The parking is located behind the building and there was some random dogs running around. Walking in I was still hesitant because it was dimly lit and there were some dried up, dusty fountains. But oh my, when the food came, I instantly fell in love with this place. Best Thai food I have ever eaten. I actually prefer it over another famously visited Thai place in springfield. Definitely worth checking out! Reasonably priced and lots of food!

data.title: Great Food
data.text: Excellent Thai food restaurant. But, they are not the fastest service I've seen. If you're not in a hurry, you will enjoy what's in store. I love the spiciness of the Mekong offerings especially the Mekong Spring Roll!

data.title: best Thai, Vietnamese and Lao food in town
data.text: I have eaten here at least three times a month, for lunch and dinner for more than five years.  The food is not overly salty or running with gravy.  The food is pleasantly spiced and not over-heated with hot peppers so you cannot taste the flavor.  Always top quality.

data.title: Wonderful Food
data.text: Doesn't look good on the outside and the interior doesn't offer much more. Casual atmosphere. Friendly and efficient services. Food is delicious. So many fresh ingredients and thoughtful preparation. My favorite is the Thai Salad with beef. Furthest thing from a salad you can imagine. Simply delicious food at a great price. A jewel in the food desert of central Illinois.

data.title: Delicious Food
data.text: Went here with a group of ten people. Service was excellent and food was delicious. Doesn't look like much from the outside but the food is top notch. Flavors were balanced perfectly. We tried a little of everything (Thai and Vietnamese dishes) and they were all very good.

data.title: First Timer, It was really great!
data.text: I invited my son and his wife for lunch today and decided to go to Mekong Cafe.  Our order was crab rangoon, patia, chicken fried rice and Thai rolls!  Man was it all good.  You get to choose from mild, medium and hot, super hot for any of the dishes you choose.  The servers are so nice and welcoming.  The food was temperature hot and got to our table really quick and that was nice due to having to go back at work in 45 minutes.  The atmosphere is really clean.  Don't expect top of the line fancy place with an elegant feel.  It is awesomely clean, nice and tidy and a real comfortable place to go in a casual atmosphere.

data.title: Best Thai in Springfield
data.text: This restaurant has the best Thai, Viet and Lao food in Springfield.  Other Thai restaurants serve their food with so much heat to hide the like of flavor.  Mekong is very flavorful and the service is great. Each meal is cooked to order and with great care. Highly recommend

data.title: Great Thai off the beaten path
data.text: I had driven by their sign for over a year before I convinced my wife that we should give it a try.  Now it's her favorite place for Thai and Vietnamese food.  The staff is always friendly and make you feel welcome.  Food always comes out hot and the portion size is generous for one.  We could easily share a meal, but my wife always insists on her own because it's so good. Go find it, park in the back and enjoy a good meal.
